content.description: This is the hardest route in the Slablands but it sticks with the theme. The crux is less than vertical and thin as can be. Climb up to the first bolt mantling onto a thin rail and gaining a shallow pocket. Better holds above lead to 5.8 friction and onto the main course. Place a .75 cam or similar and take a step right as you mantle to stand in the crack. Clip two bolts on the imposibly thin face. Manage a slopy sequence at the lip and sink into a finger crack. Move right to clip the DIvination anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts a .75 cam and bolt anchors.
content.location: The next line right of the arete

content.description: The easiest and most committing route on this wall. Start up the thin Dike on the right side. Keep your eyes out for a sneaky placement about where you start wanting one. Follow cracks and grooves up the right side of the wall. At the top you may either go less directly around the right at 5.7 or more directly at 5.8+ which I think is more fun. Either way that section is bolt protected. Move left and clip the 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: trad gear, 1 bolt to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The right side of the cliff starting up a thin smooth dike.

content.description: Climb the stunning friction slab on the left side of the wall past 4 bolts and placing a small to mid sized cam in the horizontal crack. Pure friction and some micro features keep you working most of the way. Reminiscent of Lonesome Dove at Rumney which inspired the name.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a piece of gear in the horizontal. Finger to thin hand size.
content.location: The left arete of the Divination slab.

content.description: Another line that just needed to be climbed. A thin line of dark stone shows the way to a sweet hand crack (which is sadly choked by a stump but maybe that will go away some day). Start in a pocket. Friction up to a crux mantel. Move right to another unlikely pocket and up to the crack. Jam it damnit. Sail on good gear around the unfortunate stump and up to the anchors. If the stump goes it will earn another star.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The obvious crack approached starting from the perfect pocket in the middle of the wall.

content.description: I can get a full day of climbing with just these 4 climbs. A variety of grades and styles and such high quality rock. Worth the hike.
